content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="no"?> <metadata xml:lang="en"> <Esri> <CreaDate>20140513</CreaDate> <CreaTime>10300600</CreaTime> <ArcGISFormat>1.0</ArcGISFormat> <ArcGISstyle>FGDC CSDGM Metadata</ArcGISstyle> <SyncOnce>TRUE</SyncOnce> </Esri> <dataIdInfo> <idAbs>Bayesian Shoreline Change Prediction - A Bayesian network (BN) that was developed to predict long-term shoreline change associated with sea-level rise. The data consist of information compiled as part of the U.S. Geological Survey Coastal Vulnerability Index for the U.S. coastline. In this work, the Bayesian network is used to define relationships between driving forces, geologic constraints, and coastal response which are represented by observations of local rates of relative sea-level rise, wave height, tide range, geomorphic classification, coastal slope, and shoreline change rate. Using this information, the BN is used to make probabilistic predictions of shoreline retreat in response to different future sea-level rise rates. Data Series : 601</idAbs> <searchKeys> <keyword>Bayesian Network</keyword> <keyword>Coastal Vulnerability</keyword> <keyword>Coastal Vulnerability Index</keyword> <keyword>USGS</keyword> <keyword>CMGP</keyword> <keyword>U.S. Geological Survey</keyword> <keyword>Coastal and Marine Geology Program</keyword> <keyword>Probability</keyword> <keyword>Woods Hole Coastal and Marine Science Center</keyword> <keyword>Coastal Erosion</keyword> <keyword>Shoreline Change</keyword> <keyword>Sea Level Rise</keyword> <keyword>Coastal Hazards</keyword> </searchKeys> <idPurp>Bayesian SLC Prediction</idPurp> <idCredit>U.S. Geological Survey</idCredit> <resConst> <Consts> <useLimit/> </Consts> </resConst> <idCitation> <resTitle>Bayesian SLC Prediction</resTitle> </idCitation> </dataIdInfo> <Binary> <Thumbnail> <Data EsriPropertyType="PictureX"></Data> </Thumbnail> </Binary> </metadata>
